Detailed Description

Packet used for requesting an Image over either a specific area and a route.

After the normal header this packet contains: Table begins at REQUEST_HEADER_SIZE {tabular}{lll} Pos & Size & \ 0 & 4 & \ The image format. 4 & 4 & \ The size of the GfxFeatureMapData. 8 & 2 & \ The size parameter from the server. 10 & 1 bit & \ A boolean which is true if we want a GfxExportFeatureMap in return. & 1 bit & \ A boolean which is true if we want a GfxExportScalableFeatrueMap in return. 11 & 1 & \ Minimum scale level to be included in the map. 12 & 1 & \ Maximum scale level to be included in the map. 13 & 1 & \ A byte telling what kind of arrow to draw in the map if any. Uses beforeturn and afterturn to determine where to draw the arrow. 14 & 2 & \ The number of degrees (0 - 360) the map should be rotated around its center. Clockwise rotation. 16 & 4 & \ beforeturn. 20 & 4 & \ afterturn. 24 & 4 & \ The size of the MapSettings 28 & 4 & \ The size of the copyright string 32 & string & \ The Copyright string xxx & xxx & \ The MapSettings. xxx & xxx & \ The GfxFeatureMapData.

{tabular}

uint32  size,
uint16  sizeParam,
uint8  minScaleLevel,
uint8  maxScaleLevel,
uint32  mapSettingSize,
const char *  copyright
) 
 

Creates a GfxFeatureMapRequestPacket with all parameters.

Parameters:
reqID The RequestID.
packetID The PacketID.
imageFormat The Image format
exportFormat If we want a GfxExportFeatureMap.
drawCopyRight If we want a copyright in the image.
size The size of the GfxFeatureMap.
minScaleLevel Minimum scale level included in the returned map.
maxScaleLevel Maximum scale level included in the returned map.
copyright The copyright string for the maps data.

Member Function Documentation

bool GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::alignedMapData (   )  const
 

Returns true if the packet is uint32-aligned before map data starts.

uint32 GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::getAfterturn (   )  const
 

Get the afterturn index.

NB. This is the index counting from the first rotue feature, i.e. if the empty features should be used to convert this id to the feature id in the GfxFeatureMap, 1 must be added in order to compensate for the route origin.

Returns:
afterturn index.

RouteArrowType::arrowType GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::getArrowType (   )  const
 

Get the kind of arrow to use when drawing the route in the map.

If no arrow is to be used, RouteArrowType::NOT_USED is returned.

uint32 GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::getBeforeturn (   )  const
 

Get the beforeturn index.

NB. This is the index counting from the first rotue feature, i.e. if the empty features should be used to convert this id to the feature id in the GfxFeatureMap, 1 must be added in order to compensate for the route origin.

Returns:
beforeturn index.

DataBuffer* GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::getGfxFeatureMapData (  MapSettings *  setting  )  const
 

Returns the GfxFeatureMap data and MapSettings.

Note that the buffer points into the packet so the packet must not be deleted during the lifetime of the databuffer.

ImageDrawConfig::imageFormat GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::getImageFormat (   )  const
 

Returns the Image format.

int16 GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::getMapRotation (   )  const
 

Gets the angle for the map rotation.

This method returns 0 if the map rotation has not been set explicitly.

Returns:
The angle to rotate the map before drawing. Clockwise rotation, 0 - 360 degrees.

void GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::setMapRotation (  int16  angle  ) 
 

Sets the angle to rotate the map.

If this method is not called, the map rotation is set to 0.

Parameters:
angle The angle to rotate the map. Clockwise rotation, 0 - 360 degrees.

void GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::setRouteAsArrow (  uint32  afterTurn  ) 
 

Requests the route to be drawn as an arrow and sets the route turn to use when drawing the route as an arrow.

This requires a route.

Parameters:
afterTurn The index of the feature after the turn.
NB. This is the index counting from the first rotue feature, i.e. if the empty features should be used to convert this id to the feature id in the GfxFeatureMap, 1 must be added in order to compensate for the route origin.

void GfxFeatureMapImageRequestPacket::setRouteTurn (  uint32  beforeTurn,
uint32  afterTurn
) 
 

Sets the route turn to draw on the image.

This requires a route.

Parameters:
beforeTurn The index of the feature before the turn.
NB. This is the index counting from the first rotue feature, i.e. if the empty features should be used to convert this id to the feature id in the GfxFeatureMap, 1 must be added in order to compensate for the route origin.

Parameters:
afterTurn The index of the feature after the turn.
NB. This is the index counting from the first rotue feature, i.e. if the empty features should be used to convert this id to the feature id in the GfxFeatureMap, 1 must be added in order to compensate for the route origin.
